text:
I'm not sure what you're going for. I know some vtubers in Japan use IKinema Orion for characters. Probably not what you were thinking but just passing it on

<https://ikinema.com/orion>

If you're not aware of vtubers. It's a thing in Japan. Vtuber = Virutal Youtuber and there are several popular channels where they are basically using video game tech (realtime 3d) and various kinds of input to make virutal personalities on youtube.

<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r3vcSMUVYHA>

attachments.title: IKINEMA | Motion Capture, VR, Games - Project Orion
attachments.text: IKINEMA leads in animation software for motion capture, games and virtual reality. We power animation engines for leading companies.
attachments.fallback: IKINEMA: IKINEMA | Motion Capture, VR, Games - Project Orion

attachments.title: 【令和】キズナアイ vs ファービー 口喧嘩！！

elements.text: I'm not sure what you're going for. I know some vtubers in Japan use IKinema Orion for characters. Probably not what you were thinking but just passing it on

If you're not aware of vtubers. It's a thing in Japan. Vtuber = Virutal Youtuber and there are several popular channels where they are basically using video game tech (realtime 3d) and various kinds of input to make virutal personalities on youtube.

text:
Hello Harald,

Maybe taking inspiration from Glamourous Toolkit?

<https://gtoolkit.com/>

I know it's easier said than done but the idea of being able to quickly add custom type specific visualizers to the debugger sounds like an interesting idea. I know via extensions that it's possible to add debugging extensions to the debugger but AFAIK it's a huge chore. If with infrasture and libraires I could add new type specific UI in 3-10 lines of code I'd be far more likely to do it ... maybe?

attachments.title: Glamorous Toolkit
attachments.text: The Glamorous Toolkit is the moldable development environment. For Pharo

elements.text:
Hello Harald,

Maybe taking inspiration from Glamourous Toolkit?

I know it's easier said than done but the idea of being able to quickly add custom type specific visualizers to the debugger sounds like an interesting idea. I know via extensions that it's possible to add debugging extensions to the debugger but AFAIK it's a huge chore. If with infrasture and libraires I could add new type specific UI in 3-10 lines of code I'd be far more likely to do it ... maybe?

text: Hi Ian! Sorry for the late response, but I’m fascinated by your idea and how useful it could be. There was an idea I threw around a while back, with the aim of auto-generating a load of integration/feature tests for an existing web app. This is a problem I often see: large legacy code bases where changes need to be made quickly, and there isn’t time to manually create a test suite even though everyone agrees that it’d be incredibly helpful.

elements.text: Hi Ian! Sorry for the late response, but I’m fascinated by your idea and how useful it could be. There was an idea I threw around a while back, with the aim of auto-generating a load of integration/feature tests for an existing web app. This is a problem I often see: large legacy code bases where changes need to be made quickly, and there isn’t time to manually create a test suite even though everyone agrees that it’d be incredibly helpful.

text: If you’re interested in exploring more, I’d love to help evolve some ideas if I can.

elements.text: If you’re interested in exploring more, I’d love to help evolve some ideas if I can.
